messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale
messages.msgSnippet: The person in question is known on the sword lists as a scammer, do not send him your money, save it until that day when you can look the sword and the seller
messages.messageBody:
The person in question is known on the sword lists as a scammer, do
not send him your money, save it until that day when you can look the
sword and the seller in the eye...
-t

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale
messages.msgSnippet: ... If the item is as he said, I would probably do the same thing.  It would keep it from being a total lost if it was sent to someone who did not return it.
messages.messageBody:
Kee Curlee wrote:

>
> Guys, This bum has sent me pictures, paper work, all kinds of
> documentation
> and etc. now, I asked him to send the sword for inspection, now the
> game
> gets bad. He tells me he needs money to send the sword for inspection,

If the item is as he said, I would probably do the same thing. It would
keep it from being a total lost if it was sent to someone who did not
return it. Over the internet you do not know who you are dealing with.

Of course, the important word is IF.

Dan Cooper

messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale
messages.msgSnippet: thanks for the info. No scum deserves to scam this group so ill let you know that i have already sent my men looking for him.
messages.messageBody:
thanks for the info.

No scum deserves to scam this group so ill let you know that i have already sent my men looking for him.

__________________________________________________

messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale
messages.msgSnippet: Guys, I have just got a very good price on a tanto and Katana, Just because of the Help I have receved from you guys and gals... Please by all means-- Keep up
messages.messageBody:
Guys, I have just got a very good price on a tanto and Katana, Just because
of the Help I have receved from you guys and gals... Please by all means--
Keep up the good work... Kee (Irish) Curlee...
-----Original Message-----
From: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of carl rosian
Sent: Sunday, April 24, 2005 1:25 AM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale



i would ask for some type of legally binding document that can be traced
to him.what makes him sure that the blade is authentic?has it been
appraised?ask more info.

Kee Curlee <threekeys@...> wrote:
Guys, This bum has sent me pictures, paper work, all kinds of
documentation
and etc. now, I asked him to send the sword for inspection, now the
game
gets bad. He tells me he needs money to send the sword for inspection, Now
this jamoke starts trying to bargain with this old country Mick... Bad
plan.
Kee (Irish) Curlee...
-----Original Message-----
From: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of Cepo
Sent: Saturday, April 23, 2005 5:23 AM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [samuraihistory] Fwd: Japanese XVIII Century Sword For Sale


CAREFUL GUYS... THE POLISH GUYS IS BACK!!!
cepo

and etc. now, I asked him to send the sword for inspection, now the game
gets bad. He tells me he needs money to send the sword for inspection, Now
this jamoke starts trying to bargain with this old country Mick... Bad plan.
Kee (Irish) Curlee...
